thread.title: The Wall Street Journal Calls For FBI Director Comey To Step Down
thread.title_full: The Wall Street Journal Calls For FBI Director Comey To Step Down

author: Fred Maxwell
title: The Wall Street Journal Calls For FBI Director Comey To Step Down
text:
The Wall Street Journal Calls For FBI Director Comey To Step Down "The best service Mr. Comey can render his country now ..." by Fred Maxwell January 13, 2017 at 4:05pm Advertisement - story continues below 
The Wall Street Journal is calling for FBI Director James Comey to resign. 
An editorial published Thursday in The Journal declares, “The best service Mr. Comey can render his country now is to resign.” 
“It’s no secret that the United States is a house divided in 2017, and that Americans of different political persuasions agree on little when it comes to Washington. But there’s at least one tall exception to this state of affairs, and his name is James B. Comey,” the editorial says. Advertisement - story continues below Top Democrats Question The Legitimacy Of Trump’s Victory 
It says the Journal editorial board believes Comey has let politics motivate some of his decisions as FBI director, causing damage to both political parties. 
Comey was criticized by both parties during the presidential campaign for his handling of the investigation into Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton’s use of a private email server while she was secretary of state. 
Republicans harshly criticized his decision in July to recommend that Clinton not face criminal prosecution even though he found she had been “extremely careless” in the handling of classified material. Advertisement - story continues below 
“Although there is evidence of potential violations of the statutes regarding the handling of classified information, our judgment is that no reasonable prosecutor would bring such a case,” Comey said. 
Then, 11 days before the presidential election, Comey sent a letter sent to Congress informing lawmakers of the FBI’s decision to review new information in the Clinton e-mail scandal. 
Democrats were furious , and many of them blamed the FBI director for Clinton’s defeat Nov. 8. 
The Wall Street Journal’s editorial says the fact that Comey is not liked by either party does not mean he is “an honest arbiter who is above politics.” Advertisement - story continues below
